title: 112_hr3442
content: The Act may be cited as the "Partial Hospitalization Stabilization and Integrity Act of 2011". It pertains to Medicare payment for partial hospitalization services. The Social Security Act is amended to establish a new payment methodology for partial hospitalization services under Medicare. The Social Security Act is amended to establish a new payment methodology for partial hospitalization services under Medicare, which includes consistent payment rates regardless of the provider and aims to minimize annual rate fluctuations. The Social Security Act is amended to establish a new payment methodology for partial hospitalization services under Medicare. Payments are based on a per diem rate and subject to an annual increase, with specific base rates for different services. The Social Security Act is amended to establish a new payment methodology for partial hospitalization services under Medicare, with specific base rates for different services and an annual adjustment based on a uniform inflation factor specified by the Secretary. The Social Security Act is amended to establish a new payment methodology for partial hospitalization services under Medicare. Payment is based on performance standards set by the Secretary, with adjustments for providers meeting or failing to meet these standards. The Secretary shall establish criteria for measuring providers' performance of partial hospitalization services, including access and treatment intensity standards. The Secretary will establish criteria for measuring providers' performance of partial hospitalization services, including discharge planning and continuity of care requirements. Providers must be accredited by recognized bodies to meet performance standards. The Secretary will establish criteria for measuring providers' performance of partial hospitalization services. Under the Social Security Act, the Secretary shall include items and services for mental health coverage by community mental health centers. These changes will apply to services furnished on or after January 1, 2012.
